trans-unit.source: Represents a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.

<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions and a set of conditions that must be taken into account when assessing the validity of the SAML assertion.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> class represents the set of conditions.
An example of a condition is whether the SAML assertion must not be cached, which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition> class.
The SAML specification defines two conditions and it allows for the set of conditions to be extended.
The two conditions defined by the SAML specification are <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlDoNotCacheCondition>.
To define a new condition, derive a class from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> class using the specified timeframe that the SAML assertion is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> properties are stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions"></xref> class using the specified timeframe and conditions when the SAML assertion is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter%2A> properties are stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotOnOrAfter"></xref> property.

An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> that specifies a set of conditions that a recipient of a SAML assertion must take into account in assessing the validity of the assertion.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.Conditions"></xref> property.
conditions contains a member that is `null`.
Gets the set of conditions that must be taken into consideration when assessing the validity of a SAML assertion.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.Conditions%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlCondition"></xref> that specifies a set of conditions that a recipient of a SAML assertion must take into account when assessing the validity of the assertion.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Gets the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property corresponds to the `NotBefore` attribute of the `<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the earliest instant in time when the SAML assertion is valid.
Gets the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.NotBefore%2A> property corresponds to the `NotOnOrAfter` attribute of the `<saml:Conditions>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the instant in time when the SAML assertion expires.
Reads the `<saml:Conditions>` element from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.ReadXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method sets the following properties:
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the `<saml:Conditions>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML authorization statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
Writes the `<saml:Conditions>` element into the specified XML serializer.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions.WriteXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%29> method to write the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> instance into a `<saml:Conditions>` element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the `<saml:Conditions>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
writer is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
